original_solution_mapping.L1: The cat got a 15/60=<<15/60=.25>>.25 hour head start
original_solution_mapping.L3: The rabbit goes 25-20=<<25-20=5>>5 mph faster than the cat
original_solution_mapping.L4: So it takes 5/5=<<5/5=1>>1 hour for the rabbit to catch up

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1875.
    Returns: the time in hours for the rabbit to catch up to the cat.
    """
    # L1
    head_start_minutes = 15 # 15-minute head start
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # WK
    head_start_hours = head_start_minutes / minutes_per_hour

    # L2
    cat_speed = 20 # His cat can run 20 miles per hour
    cat_head_start_distance = cat_speed * head_start_hours

    # L3
    rabbit_speed = 25 # Tom's rabbit can run at 25 miles per hour
    speed_difference = rabbit_speed - cat_speed

    # L4
    time_to_catch_up = cat_head_start_distance / speed_difference

    # FA
    answer = time_to_catch_up
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The cat got a {head_start_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}=<<{head_start_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={head_start_hours}>>{head_start_hours} hour head start
The rabbit goes {rabbit_speed}-{cat_speed}=<<{rabbit_speed}-{cat_speed}={speed_difference}>>{speed_difference} mph faster than the cat
So it takes {cat_head_start_distance}/{speed_difference}=<<{cat_head_start_distance}/{speed_difference}={time_to_catch_up}>>{time_to_catch_up} hour for the rabbit to catch up

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: The cat got a 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour head start
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The rabbit goes 25-20=<<25-20=5>>5 mph faster than the cat
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: So it takes 20/5=<<20/5=4>>4 hour for the rabbit to catch up

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'minutes_per_hour' (60) was used instead of 'head_start_minutes' (15).
